title: Localization Analyst
content:
At Qualtrics, we create software that the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform. We are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18,000 clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and an appreciation for the unconventional—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers. When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set ambitious goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged, and complex problems are solved by collaborating and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities— they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.
 
Why We Have This Role

A Localization Analyst on the Global Experience team enables enable great language experiences for our Japanese-speaking customers when they interact with Qualtrics content. This is done through a combination of project management work to make content available in Japanese (operational) and of translation / content creation work, which will abide by language quality standards that can steer our global content towards higher customer value.
 

 
How You’ll Find Success


Be a self starter able to work independently with minimal supervision yet able to promptly recognise and escalate issues and request help when required
Be highly dependable and have proven ability to bring home high-stakes projects and to keep all of the relevant stakeholders informed re status at all times
Partner with other team members to offer cross-cultural expertise on-demand
Be a very strong team player and able to form and nurture meaningful working relationships despite of the reduced overlap with other team members’ time zones
Have strong stakeholder management skills, and a proven track record of steering successfully important cross-functional projects
Have a good understanding of what it means to work across cultures and timezones
Assess and reduce the impact of  risks related to in-flight projects in partnership with the team’s leadership


 
 
Things You’ll Do


Lead the localization quality management work for Japan, based on a Qualtrics content tiering system and set of content standards that can serve as a blueprint for our multilingual approaches across languages and content types
Create and maintain frameworks for high-value multilingual content for our Japanese-speaking customers
Generate and deliver enablement and training resources to equip our extended network of external language experts with the tools to perform translations that meet our quality standards for each content type. Build/grow this network in Japan
Manage and enable the localization of sensitive/strategic Qualtrics content or content with highly specific requirements, such as flagship global methodology content
Increase the accessibility and availability of marketing and sales content in the Japanese market and some areas of support content globally
Support the Qualtrics language quality metrics program to track translation performance over time, document issue prevention and encourage best practices in the localization of Qualtrics content
Ensure content alignment and brand adherence on the Qualtrics localization tech hub
Advise and partner with other team members on certain translation initiatives to ensure top customer value from a language quality perspective
Contribute to process redesign for language-related initiatives
Advise Engineering and Design teams on best practices for an optimized experience for Japanese-speaking customers (documentation, participate in office hours)
Provide localization outreach and educational initiatives and resources for client-facing teams


 
What We’re Looking For On Your CV


4 years of directly relevant experience
You have prior experience translating and creating content, ideally within the SaaS space but definitely in tech
You have a track-record of delivering high-quality Japanese content whose storytelling element has been adapted to be fit for the Japanese market
You have experience in content project management within fast-paced environments with complex stakeholder landscapes
You have degree in linguistics, writing, translations or demonstrable equivalent work experience
You have a strong command of English as most stakeholder and team communications will take place in English
You have a basic understanding of how content affects user experience and an appetite to learn more about it


 
What You Should Know About This Team
 
We are a multinational and multicultural team whose mission is to allow Qualtrics to engage with a global user base by creating and curating multiple language content that truly communicates our brand’s voice and value proposition. Every bit of content that needs to become available to prospects and customers in different languages goes via our team, which is part of Qualtrics Product Content Studio. This includes platform content, pitch decks, web pages, demo content, ebooks, support and enablement content, and more.
 Besides creating content from scratch and translating it into over 70 languages, we manage multiple content projects from inception to publishing. In addition, we procure and manage the language technology that allows tens of internal teams to efficiently make their content available in multiple languages by seamlessly integrating their own systems with a range of API, translation management and machine translation capabilities. Right now, we are looking into how to plug in Gen AI into our workflows to become more yet faster and more efficient.
 
 

Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic. ​​​​​​​Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family & Medical Leave Act, Equal Opportunity Employment, Employee Polygraph Protection ActQualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.
 
Qualtrics Work Experience - As we look to the future, we believe that our teams are better together. Being together will help us learn more, grow faster and ultimately deliver better results for our customers and Qualtrics. Roles tied to an office location work 4 days per week in the office together and 1 day from home, with a strong spirit of flexibility around taking time for personal, health, and family moments in our work weeks. Our managers work with their teams to create a collaborative, engaged work environment, and arrangement that works for each of our team members.
 
Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.
